subject: RE: Barrett
bodySnippet:
--000000000000cb355d062071b214
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="000000000000cb3557062071b213"

--000000000000cb3557062071b213
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Did you include a loan scenario letter detailing exactly what was going on
with the loan? I include that on all my files so whomever touches knows
exactly what I want them to do, no confusion and no mistakes. I am sure you
already have something like that in place.  PFN put Danny as a safeguard
for Christina=E2=80=99s first few loans, it=E2=80=99s the policy that Jerem=
y backed and
finally decided on.



I would be happy to speak with everyone and try a determine a time that
works for everyone, it will not be Monday. The fact of the matter is that I
don=E2=80=99t see what were are going to talk about, right now all manageme=
nt has
chimed in and are very much aware of your dissatisfaction.



The takeaway for me on this is that we are putting all the resources we
have available to assist you with your loans. Anything over and above what
we are during right now is not possible, you need to be aware you are not
the only loan officer who is having a hard time with the Byte integration.
Coupled with the fact you have a new hire in Christine, she is still
getting the ropes of the new system and staff, I have no doubt in no-time
at all she will be rocking and rolling.



Again, we are asking for your patience Lisa. You currently have 3 people
assigned to help you, not counting sales support. You need to take
everything down a notch because simply put, PFN is going through growing
pains.



A long conversation about how our best at this time is not good enough is
not going to accomplish anything. Your loans will close on time, your TBD
approvals will be worked on and most importantly you have the teams
support. If you feel like you do not have our support then we have to agree
to disagree.

I discussed in detail with Lisa that during the BYTE transition our
resources are spread very thin but I am confident things will settle in and
we will be able to offer my expedited services to her.



We did not go into detail as to what offerings PFN will be providing as we
are providing her with everything she has requested for the exception of
transferring the files into BYTE.

g
